content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you will find the apartment to your liking. So, what price were you considering for the rental?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you, Mister Schmidt. I'm looking for a fair price, considering the location and the quality of the apartment. I was thinking around 1000 Euro per month would be reasonable. What do you think?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I appreciate your perspective. However, I must be honest with you. The price you mentioned is lower than what I was expecting for this apartment. It's a prime location, and the building is brand new. I believe a price closer to 1200 Euro per month would be more in line with market value. What is your counter-offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your expertise in real estate is evident. I understand that the market value might be higher, but as a student, I'm looking for a price that aligns with my budget. Could we perhaps meet in the middle? Say, 1100 Euro per month? I believe this would be a fair compromise.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, you seem to be a reasonable person. Your offer of 1100 Euro per month is closer to what I had in mind. However, I still believe that 1200 Euro would be more fair for both parties. This is a luxurious apartment with all the amenities, and the demand for such properties is high. If you can match my asking price, I'm sure we can come to an agreement. What do you say?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I understand your position. The apartment is indeed luxurious, and the location is prime. However, as a student, I have to be mindful of my expenses. Could we perhaps discuss additional perks or a longer lease term? These could potentially offset the higher price point.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I'm willing to listen to any counter-proposal you have. How long were you considering for the lease term? And what additional perks would you be interested in?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you, Mister Schmidt. I was thinking of a 12-month lease term, with the option to extend if both parties are agreeable. As for additional perks, perhaps a reduction in the security deposit or a few months of free parking would be beneficial. These could help offset the higher rental price. What do you think?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, your proposal for a 12-month lease with the option to extend is acceptable. Regarding the security deposit, I'm willing to reduce it by 50 Euro. However, I cannot offer free parking as the building does not have its own parking facilities. Nevertheless, I'm willing to negotiate on the rental price if you are willing to increase your offer. How does 1150 Euro per month sound to you? This is the highest price I'm willing to accept for this apartment.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your offer of 1150 Euro per month is very close to my budget limit. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate and reduce the security deposit. With these terms, I believe we can reach an agreement. I agree to the price of 1150 Euro per month!
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I agree to the price of 1150 Euro per month! Please sign the lease agreement, and we'll proceed with the rental process. Congratulations on finding a great apartment!
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
